moves.1. g3 b5 2. Bg2: Danger! Protect your rooks. A good move would have been pawn to c6, especially queen-side where you are not as likely to want to castle.
moves.3... c6: HEY!!  YOU'VE TRAPPED MY BISHOP! devious.
moves.4. Nf3: I move my knight to fill the hole in my line, control the center of the board, and open the way for castling.
moves.5. O-O: Castle! My king is in his castle. My rook is in danger from your bishop c8 though.
moves.6. b3: let's get my other bishop out..
moves.6... d6: Bad idea! my bishop is no longer trapped. He can kill your pawn, threaten your king, and escape, twirling his mustache!
moves.7. Bb2: ..but I suck, I confused the king and queen, so thought it wouldn't work and advanced my other bishop instead. More firepower aimed at the center of the board, and your other rook.
moves.7... Nd7: OH NO YOU DIDN'T. you did.
moves.8... Nb6: You threaten my bishop. Do I notice?
moves.10. Nxc6: I think I noticed my mistake... here. Queencheck!
moves.12. f3: I get nervous about defense. Make my king some room to maneuver.
moves.13... Bd5 14. a4: Pawn clearing the way for my rook to charge in..
moves.14... Na8c7 15. axb5 Nb8 16. Rxa7: Horseys have fled, but I can still apply pressure.
moves.16... Bh6 17. b6: Oh you are in trouble now. Either you lose a knight or a queen.
moves.17... Kd8 18. bxc7+: Guess it's just a knight :( Czech.
moves.18... Qxc7 19. Rxc7: OH NO, YOU DIDN'T. Guess it's a knight AND a queen. You should have retreated your king! i couldn't have advanced the pawn without losing my rook. A fair trade (for me.)
